arm_group.arm_group_label: erythema migrans patients treated with antibiotics
arm_group.description: adult patients with erythema migrans will be treated with oral antibiotics

brief_summary.textblock:
The main objective of this study is to characterize the inflammatory proteins, gene
      polymorphisms, and transcriptome profiles in patients with erythema migrans to gain better
      insight into pathogenesis of early Lyme borreliosis and to define new immune modulators that
      could serve as biomarkers of disease activity.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cytokines and Chemokines in Erythema Migrans

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  erythema migrans in patients > 18 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  pregnancy or lactation

          -  taking antibiotic with antiborrelial activity within 10 days

intervention.arm_group_label: erythema migrans patients treated with antibiotics
intervention.description: Patient will be treated with: doxycycline orally, 100 mg, bid, 14 days or cefuroxime axetil orally, 500 mg, bid, 14 days or amoxicillin orally, 500 mg, tid, 14 days

facility.name: UMC Ljubljana, Department of Infectious Diseases

clinical_study.official_title: Inflammatory Proteins, Gene Polymorphisms, and Transcriptome Profiles in Patients With Erythema Migrans

other_outcome.description: We will use RNA sequencing of individual immune cell subtypes from patients to determine their transcriptome.
other_outcome.measure: transcriptome profiles in erythema migrans patients

primary_outcome.description: The inflammatory immune profiles will be assessed using Luminex to measure the expression of cytokines and chemokines representative of innate and adaptive TH1, TH2, TH17, and B cell responses in serum and if available, skin, of patients during active infection and after treatment.
primary_outcome.measure: inflammatory proteins in erythema migrans patients

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 09, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The expression of disease-relevant genomic variants will be assessed using ImmunoChip.
secondary_outcome.measure: gene polymorphisms in erythema migrans patients

collaborator.agency: University of Ljubljana School of Medicine,  Slovenia

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
